about.title: About
about.content:
AMAX Leather is a supplier of premium leather furniture products to the North American market. Since 1992, we have offered high-quality products to our customers and have become one of the leading leather furniture providers. Our production facilities in China provide us with an extremely efficient supply chain.

AMAX is known for its excellence in quality, durability, comfort and style. We believe in providing comfortable and stylish products that are built to last. We are always looking to exceed our own expectations and our team of talented designers are always busy bringing new designs to life. These are offered to our customers both in-stock and mixed container programs.

craftsmanship.title: Craftsmanship
craftsmanship.content:
Stationary Collections

Leather

Dyed-through top grain leather with different premium finishing options to choose from: Antique handrubbed, Distressed, Semi Aniline, Pull up, and Corrected

Frame

Our frames are Kiln-dried. The process removes most of the moisture inside the wood thereby prolonging its life. Due to the moisture reduction, wood doesn’t warp or shrink with changes in humidity and temperature. L-braced hardwood frames, glued at the corners, add to the durability and longevity of our products

Spring

Pocketed-coils and No-Sag springs provide balanced weight distribution offering maximum durability and lasting comfort. Pocketed-coil spring systems have separate springs individually wrapped in fabric that allows each pocketed spring to move independently, thereby responding quickly to movement and conforming to the contours of your body

Seat Cushion

Down feather and 2.25lbs density foam core are double-wrapped with hollow fill fiber to create a plush seat cushion

Motion Collections

We use only recognized and trusted quality suppliers

Leggett and Platt reclining mechanisms in our motion upholstery
Okin motor in our power recliners

Power Functions

Equipped with up to three power reclining features including Lay-flat Power Recline, Power Tilting Headrest and Power Lumbar Support. A built-in USB charging ports is on each recliner control panel

Heated seats are also available in our motion collection

Memory Foam

High-density memory foam is resilient and conforms to the shape of your body, thereby providing even support and lessening the sagging effect. It is as comfortable as it is durable

leather-care.title: leather care
leather-care.content:
Leather furniture can last longer and look better by proper care to preserve its natural characteristics.

Genuine Leather Characteristics

It is important to remember that due to its genuine features, leather has natural wrinkles as well as slight color and texture variations. Hence, leather furniture gives a completely natural look and feel to your home.

" width="609" height="395" />

Leather Furniture Guide

Leather has limited elasticity. To keep your leather and cushions new and fluffy, use the seating areas evenly. It is also important not to lean, sit or reach over the back of the sofa as any pulling or tugging might result in a tear.

Allowing pets on your leather furniture is not recommended. Their claws and saliva can harm the leather finish.

Room Temperature

Position your leather furniture away from direct sunlight, high-wattage lights, heating and air conditioning units to prevent leather from drying out.

furniture-care.title: furniture care
furniture-care.content:
Caring Tips

It is normal for seat cushions to become ‘worn in’ and soften overtime. In order to ensure that cushions return to their intended look, you can simply massage or smooth the cushions by hand. Do not jump on the sofa, or sit on the arm or back.

Furniture Handling

If the sofa needs to be moved, avoid lifting from the armrest and arm pillows; the correct way to move the sofa is by lifting from the base or underside of the arms. Never move the sofa by pushing or pulling it.

cleaning.title: cleaning
cleaning.content:
Dusting

Gently wiping your leather once a week with a clean dry or slightly damp soft cloth to avoid build-up of dirt and dust. Avoid using chemical cleaners as it can discolor a patch on your furniture.

Spills

Clean up spills immediately by dabbing with a soft cloth. For greasy stains, a colorless soap can be used, wiping the stain from the outside towards the center. Remove any residual soap with a damp white cloth, and dry the area with a clean white towel. Never use heat to hasten drying.
